title: Since when was it okay to tell someone to kill themslves?
body: So I was just chilling in aram after a break when my twitch says "Zed, kill yourself"(i was the zed) for some reason. And when I say oh that should be a ban he responds with "ahhaha sure i've never been banned before" and I was like kill yourself should be an insta 14 day but apparently he did not even get banned??? what the actual fuck is this riot. Are you legit allowing ppl to tell others to kill themslves or what? I really want someone to check that games gamelog and seriosuly do something about it cus that is not okay at all! {{sticker:sg-ahri-3}}

replies.body:
>And when I say oh that should be a ban he responds with "ahhaha sure i've never been banned before" and I was like kill yourself should be an insta 14 day but apparently he did not even get banned???

 The IFS message is inconsistent, if you did report him and he received a 14-day suspension or permanent ban you would have no way of knowing for sure.

 And of course, errors can always occur and if you don't report someone with the correct option (hate speech, not negative language) they might get as low as a 10 game chat restriction instead of the correct punishment.

Either way, [**you can file a support ticket to have someone check those logs.**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) They won't share the outcome of the punishment, but they'll look into it.
Thank you! ill try this then.

> I really want someone to check that games gamelog and seriosuly do something about it cus that is not okay at all! 

Sure, send the people below what you said here and a link to that particular match.

https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us
Dont worry, its very against the rules, and easily detected by the automated system.

Never.
It’s never been ok.

You rarely get any messages to signify you, you either rely on good faith or checking their logs on a third party website like op.gg.
